[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Veterinary Management System (VMS) defines requirements for managing animal admissions, owners, appointments, physicians, and medical conditions.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: VMS supports animal records, owner details, appointment scheduling, physician tracking, and condition logging.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: VMS integrates with pet databases, veterinary systems, and scheduling tools.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: VMS provides dashboards for clinic staff to manage records, owners, and medical history.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: VMS supports barcode scanners for IDs and tablets for documentation.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: VMS uses relational databases and REST APIs for data management.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: VMS secures data access via encryption and authentication.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: VMS manages animal intake, owners, appointments, and condition tracking.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: VMS connects with adoption agencies, veterinary networks, and regulators.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: VMS handles animal intake, owner records, appointments, physicians, and conditions.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Designed for clinic staff, veterinarians, and administrators.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: Depends on accurate data and physician availability.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with pet databases and veterinary networks to manage animal and owner records (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall synchronize appointment schedules with physician availability (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall support animal registration, including owner-less rescues (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall enable appointment scheduling with physicians (REQ-DB-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall track medical conditions recorded during consultations (REQ-DB-003).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an interactive dashboard for managing records, owners, and appointments.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall retrieve and update records without significant delay.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store animal and owner details, including breed, ID, and contact information.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall maintain appointment records, including date, time, and physician assignments.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-003: The system shall store medical condition details, including common and scientific names.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall enforce unique identification for animals, owners, and physicians.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with veterinary data protection and healthcare regulations.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall log all modifications to records, appointments, and medical conditions.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Unit and integration tests validate animal registration, appointment scheduling, and condition tracking.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: Includes user manuals, API documentation, and compliance guidelines.
[SEC] 5. References: Veterinary regulations, clinic standards, and healthcare policies.
